abstract.text: An object that manages the queue of scheduled asset downloads.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: to schedule and cancel asset downloads, monitor their progress, and access the queue of pending downloads. You don’t create instances of this class directly; instead, use the
property to access the framework’s singleton that it shares between your app and the app’s extension. Because the download manager is a shared resource, prevent race conditions by using the

methods to assume absolute control of the manager before you schedule asset downloads or manipulate those already in the manager’s queue. To respond to asset download events and process concluded downloads, create a type that conforms to the
protocol and assign an instance of it to the download manager’s
The following example shows how to create an asset download, acquire exclusive control of the shared download manager, and then use the manager to schedule the download:

code: // Assign the manager's delegate so the framework can notify
// the app of asset download events.
// Attempt to acquire exclusive control of the manager.
// Return immediately if that attempt fails.
// Use the manager to schedule the asset download.

abstract.text: Schedule background downloads of large assets after app installation, when the app updates, and periodically while the app remains on-device.
An object that manages the queue of scheduled asset downloads.
Cancels an asset download.
The download manager’s delegate.
Fetches the contents of the manager’s download queue.
Schedules an asset download to execute in the background at a nonspecific time in the future.
The download manager that both the app and the extension share.
Schedules an asset download that executes immediately in the foreground.
Attempts to acquire immediate, exclusive access to the download manager.
An interface for reacting to asset download events and processing concluded downloads.
An interface for reacting to app life-cycle events and processing concluded asset downloads while your app isn’t running.
An interface for reacting to app life-cycle events and processing concluded asset downloads while your app isn’t running.
Fetch the assets your app requires before its first launch using an app extension and the Background Assets framework.

doc://com.apple.backgroundassets/documen.title: Downloading essential assets in the background

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
